precedents.citation: Bhowanipur Banking Corporation Ltd. v. Durgesh Nandini Desi  1942  I.L.R. I Cal. 1.

anchor.surface_text: Bhowanipur Banking Corporation Ltd. v. Durgesh Nandini Desi  1942  I.L.R. I Cal. 1., In all criminal cases reparation where possible is the duty of the offender, and is to be encouraged. It would be a public mischief if on reparation being made or promised by the offender or his friends or relative mercy shown by the injured party should be used as a pretext for avoiding the reparation promised.

precedents.case_name: Bhowanipur Banking Corporation Ltd v Durgesh Nandini Desi
precedents.cited_proposition: In all criminal cases reparation where possible is the duty of the offender, and is to be encouraged. It would be a public mischief if on reparation being made or promised by the offender or his friends or relative mercy shown by the injured party should be used as a pretext for avoiding the reparation promised.
